data.title: "LORNA DOONE" AT WEST'S.
data.meta_description: The Doone outlaws and their followers are almost as interesting a crew as the pirates of "Treasure Island." Seldom has a more striking figure appeared on the ...
data.text:
'LORN A DOONE' AT WEST'S.

The Doone outlaws and their, followers

are almost as interesting a crew as the

pirates of 'Treasure. Island.' Seldom has

a more striking figure appeared on the

screen than Sir Ensor Doone, the noble

man who turned bandit after he was

robbed of his estates. 'Lorna Doone,' a

photo-drama alive with glorious romance

and gripping action of the book, is being

screened at West's this week, in which the

beautiful Jiadge Bellamy plays the leading

feminine role, supported by Messrs. John

Bowers and Frank Keenan_ Tlie story

contains 'every requirement for a master

picture production— ^ramatic force, thrill

ing action, «nd poignant heart interest.

The second attraction, 'Lpveland,' isi a

Fox special production, in which the little

star. Miss Shirley Mason, shines as an

uufortunate victim of ?circumstances, At

the afternoon and evening sessions vocal

numbers are rendered by lv. Irvan Yvain.

Reviews and gazettes are' screened, - and

?West's Viceregal Orchestra contributes

first-class music, under the baton of Mr.

James Wilton.
